results.title: Greenland recent geophysical research
results.brief_description: Film shot by scientists on the 1952-54 British North Greenland Expedition has been assembled to reveal some aspects of the work. The assistant glaciologist, Peter Taylor, discusses the objects of the expedition and their findings. Describes the process of measuring the depth of the ice in the centre of Greenland and the investigation of the shape of the rock bed beneath. Further proof is added to the theory that Greenland is a vast saucer filled with ice and that the surface of the land at the centre is below sea level. The scientists also investigated whether this mass of ice is increasing or decreasing.

results.title: Greenkeeping
results.creator_credit: Central Park Films, Glenys Rowe and David Caesar
results.brief_description: One thing after another seems to have gone wrong for the not so bright greenkeeper Lenny (Mark Little). In his professional life he has to contend with brown grass, in his personal life his dope smoking wife (Lisa Hensley) is running up debts with her dealers. He tries to secure the affections of a waitress at the bowling club, but like most other aspects of his life, he lucks out. Things reach a crisis point when Lenny’s lack of greenkeeping skills could result in a loss for the club at the forthcoming Pennant Day. Director David Caesar’s first feature reflects a nostalgia for a simpler time and place.

results.title: Greening out
results.creator_credit: Midas Interactive, Robyn Silber and Jacqueline Turnure
results.brief_description: Set against the background of music from The Whitlams, Alex Lloyd and Rumanastone, “Greening out” offers a candid view of teenagers and marijuana use. Teenagers in rural areas discuss what drives them to drugs, siting isolation, lack of things to do and depression. They talk openly about their experiences and what they’ve learnt from it. Salient medical advice is provided, with particular emphasis on how marijuana affects individuals in the formative adolescent years and how it affects your emotions and social interaction. Musicians Alex Lloyd and Tim Freedman also share their experiences with the drug. Cartoons intersperse the discussion, illustrating youth culture and drugs in action. Also includes interviews with Triple JJJ announcers Sarah Macdonald and Caroline Tran who discuss the pressures on youth today, and how they themselves cope with pressure. Dedicated to Chiquita Sturges. Suitable for secondary level students.

results.title: Greenhouse whitefly
results.creator_credit: Shell Film Unit and Stephen Ackroyd
results.brief_description: The Greenhouse Whitefly, being of tropical origin, occurs in temperate regions only in greenhouses where is causes serious damage to tomato crops. Illustrates the following: Identification of the eggs laid on the under-surface of the leaf; the white powdery wax covering the body of the nymph; degeneration of the nymph; the pupal states; emergence of the adult whitefly; the insect attacking tomato leaves; introduction of the parasite into greenhouses to control the pest.

results.title: Greenhouse effect: we can all make a difference
results.brief_description: An animated collage of fast-moving images which focuses on the problems of the Green-house effect and what solutions can be tried. Would provide an interesting starting point for discussion with upper primary/lower secondary students.

results.title: Greenhouse
results.creator_credit: Barr Films and William C. Crain
results.brief_description: A young boy’s work to repair a greenhouse he has vandalised helps him top appreciate the beauty of nature and to learn the meaning of friendship and a respect for the property of others.

results.title: Greenhide
results.creator_credit: Australian Film Productions and Charles Chauvel
results.brief_description: Out of boredom, a high society girl visits her father’s outback cattle station. After several adventures involving a gang of ruthless cattle duffers, she falls in love with the manager of the station. Cast includes Elsie Sylvaney, Bruce Gordon, Jules Murray-Prior, Irma Deardon, Frank thorn, alfred Greenup, Gerald Barlow. Silent film with intertitles.

results.title: Green Winter
results.brief_description: Elda Hartley set out to make a film about ageing and realised, as a senior citizen herself, she would make a good subject for her film. She candidly examines her own life - “Its not death that bothers me - it’s the deterioration of my mind and body.” Elda sorts through her experience with other cultures and religions, illustrating certain points from many films, and takes an intimate look at her relationship with her husband, Irving, whose failing health demands her complete attention. A personal, yet comprehensive approach to the issues of aging.

results.title: Green to glory
results.creator_credit: British Pathe Production and Lionel Hoare
results.brief_description: A film about British motor racing, featuring such famous drivers as Jim Clark and Graham Hill. Some of the behind-the-scenes activities of mechanics and designers are shown and the film describes how motor racing leads to improvement in saloon cars. Various types of races are seen, from the amateur hill climb to the professional Grand Prix. Emphasis is placed on the high international reputation of Britain’s designers and drivers.

results.title: Green tea and cherry ripe
results.brief_description: Green Tea and Cherry Ripe tells the story of six Japanese women who married Australian servicemen after the Second World War, their efforts to build new lives in Australia and the challenges they faced in an alien land.
